availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. J. Hudspeth (Graves County KY, Weakley Co. TN / merchant)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, and Weakley County, Tennessee, merchant. Tennessee native. Married to Arvilla Hudspeth. Father of Laura Hudspeth, William Hudspeth, Mary Ella Hudspeth, and Ripley Hudspeth. Clerk in dry goods house in Graves County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Merchant in Weakley County, Tennessee, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Weakley County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 173.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 44A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Weakley County, District 13, p. 450.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Weakley County, District 13, p. 467B.
